name: Shakshuka
description: A Middle Eastern dish of eggs poached in a spicy tomato and pepper sauce, served over corn grits.

ingredients.item: 1 (28-ounce) can diced tomatoes, including the liquid
1 ½ teaspoons hawayej or teaspoon curry powder
1 ½ teaspoon freshly squeezed lemon juice
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions: Mise en Place:
Preheat the oven to 350°F
Open tomato can and pour into a large saucepan
Chop garlic and put into large saucepan
Measure 1 ½ teaspoons hawayej and 1 teaspoon Aleppo pepper into large saucepan
Measure 2 Tablespoons olive oil into large saucepan
Cut lemon in half and reserve.
Spicy Tomato Sauce
Place large saucepan over low heat and simmer until the tomatoes are soft and melted, about 15 minutes.
Set the sauce aside to cool slightly.
Using an immersion blender and starting at low speed, puree the sauce, gradually increasing the speed as the mixture becomes smoother and resembles a silky tomato soup.
Stir in the lemon juice
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate up for up to I week or use immediately.
Making the Shakuka
Gently reheat the sauce
Pour sauce into desired pot
Crack each egg into a small bowl or ramekin to ensure that the yolks stay intact.
Using the back of a spoon, make a divot for each egg and slide it onto the spoon into the sauce, one at a time, so that it doesn't float on top; leave a little space between each egg.
Lightly season the eggs with salt and transfer to the oven.
Bake until the egg whites are just barely set and the yolks are very loose, about 20 minutes.
While eggs are baking, prepare corn grits according to package instructions
Serve in bowl with grits at the bottom and shakshuka on top.
